content: row are worked back-and-forth for the inside of the waist-band row 1 rs k all sts row 2 ws p all sts row 3 5 work in stockinette sts as est above row 6 rs the folding line of the waist-band p all sts using the circular needle size 3 mm/us2 5 join sts in the round making sure not to twist the sts pm in front of the first st this marker is placed at the centre back and indicates the bor work is continued from rs and in the round using mc work 5 rounds in stockinette sts k all sts end at bor on the following round work increases sizes 2 and 3 start the round by working a m1l thereafter all sizes k9 k1fb repeat - a total of 12/13/15 times = 132/144/166 sts in the round continue work the following pattern-repeat of 5 rounds round 1 using cc sm k all sts to end of round round 2 using cc sm using the tip of your rhn pick up the strand of cc in front of the following st lifting it from back to front and placing it in front of the first st on your lhn knit the strand together with the first st to the left k all sts to end of round round 3 using cc sm k all sts to end of round round 4 using mc sm k all sts to end of round round 5 using mc sm using the tip of your rhn pick up the strand of mc in front of the following st lifting it from back to front and placing it in front of the first st on your lhn knit the strand together with the first st to the left k all sts to end of round continue work repeating above 5 rounds until work measures approximately 14/16/18 cm = 5 5/6 25/7 measured from the folding line of the waist-band end at bor make sure that you have ended after 2 rounds of mc on the following round work is divided for the 2 legs using cc k66/72/83 sts place the rem 66/72/83 sts on a separate holder or on waste-yarn if using waste-yarn make sure to secure the yarn properly to avoid dropping sts turn work on the first 4 row you decrease one st at the beginning and end of row row 1 ws using cc p2tog p until 2 sts rem p2tog row 2 rs using cc ssk k until 2 sts rem k2tog row 3 ws using mc p2tog p until 2 sts rem p2tog row 4 rs using mc ssk k until 2 sts rem k2tog after row 4 you have 58/66/75 sts rem in the row 10 the following 10 row work the stripe-pattern row 1 ws using cc p all sts row 2 rs using cc k all sts row 3 ws using cc p all sts row 4 rs using mc k all sts row
